intro: Indosasa wuningensis, commonly known as the Wuning indosasa, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow or greenish in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
